thread.title: Four Chippewas Earn All-MAC Football Honors
thread.title_full: Four Chippewas Earn All-MAC Football Honors

title: Four Chippewas Earn All-MAC Football Honors
text:
Four Chippewas Earn All-MAC Football Honors
12/5/2024 11:00:00 AM | Football
Offensive lineman Brayden Swartout, linebacker Jordan Kwiatkowski, and defensive back/return specialist Donte Kent earn Second Team honors; running back Marion Lukes is a Third Team honoree.
CLEVELAND, Ohio—Four Central Michigan football players earned 2024-25 All-Mid-American Conference honors, the conference announced on Thursday morning.
For the Chipppewas, earning Second Team honors were senior offensive lineman
Both Kent and Lukes earned All-MAC honors for the third consecutive year, while Swartout is a second-year honorees.
The All-MAC team and yearly football awards are picked and voted upon by the conference's 12 head football coaches. The entire team is posted below.
In his five-year, 53-game, 48-start career at Central Michigan, Kent made 235 tackles (171 solo), 4.5 tackles for loss, 1.5 sack, two forced fumbles, one fumble recovery and one blocked kick. He set the school's career record with 47 career pass breakups and ranked No. 2 all-time in passes defended (49). With his 13.56 yards per punt return, he ended his career ranked No. 10 on the school's season list. The Harrisburg, Pa. native entered the year as a Jim Thorpe Award Watch list player and consensus All-MAC preseason honoree. Kent is a Sport Management major. He has accepted an invitation to the Hula Bowl.
An Essexville, Mich. native, Swartout takes home All-MAC honors for the second time in his career. In 2024, Swartout started and played in 11 of 12 games at right tackle and was part of CMU's offensive line that allowed just 26 sacks on the year. Over his four-year career, Swartout has seen action in 39 games, started 36 career games, and started 29 consecutive contests at one point. A preseason All-MAC player for the last two years, Swartout also served as a team captain in two games and is a Professional Sales major.
Kwiatkowski, a Sterling Heights, Mich. native, earned All-MAC honors for the first time in his career. In 2024, he led Central Michigan in tackles (96), solo tackles (48), tackles for loss (14.0-30 yards), intercepted one pass, broke up another pass, and had a quarterback hurry. In MAC statistics, he ranked No. 8 in tackles (8.0 per game) and No. 3 in tackles for loss (1.17). Kwiatkowki led CMU in tackles in five games including nine in the opener vs. CCSU, a career-high 15 vs. Ball State, 12 at Eastern Michigan, 11 vs. Bowling Green, and eight at Toledo. Over his three-year, 11-start, 34-game career, Kwiatkowski has amassed 138 tackles (69 solo), 14.5 tackles for loss for 31 yards, intercepted one pass and broke up five passes. He has totaled 10 or more tackles in six career games.
A Charlestown, Ind. native, Lukes is a three-time All-MAC honoree (First Team as a kickoff returner in 2023, Third Team in 2021, Third Team in 2024). He also played a leadership role as he served as team captain for all 12 games. As a preseason nominee for the Doak Walker and Paul Hornung Award and consensus preseason All-MAC recipient, Lukes led the Chippewas in all-purpose yardage (1,290), rushing yards (788), rushing touchdowns (five), kickoff returns (22-342), and total touchdowns scored (six). He averaged 4.9 yards per carry (161-788), caught 16 passes for 160 yards and a touchdown, and averaged 15.55 yards per kickoff return (22-342) with a long of 39 yards. He concluded the year ranked No. 27 in the nation in all-purpose yardage (117.27), ranked No. 8 in the MAC in rushing yards (71.6 yards per game), and No. 2 in all-purpose yards (117.3 yards per game).
In his 44-game career, Lukes has totaled 3,988 combined all-purpose yards and scored 17 total touchdowns. He has rushed for 1,942 yards and 13 touchdowns on 378 attempts, No 59 passes for 605 yards and two touchdowns, and totaled 1,441 kickoff return yards on 70 attempts (20.8 yards per return). Of his 17 touchdowns scored, he has 13 rushing, two receiving, and two on kickoff returns. In his career, he has five 100-yard rushing games, three 200-yard all-purpose games, 15 100-yard all-purpose games, two 3-touchdown games, and 15 100-yard all-purpose games. He concluded his career ranked No. 11 in all-purpose yards (3,988), No. 3 in kickoff return yards (1,441), ranked tied for No. 1 in kick return touchdowns (2), and No. 10 in average yards per kick return. Lukes is an Entrepreneurship major.
Central Michigan finished 4-8 overall and 2-6 in the MAC.
Below are the All-MAC selections and award-winners:

Special Teams Player of the Year: Malcolm Gillie, KR, Ball State

For the Chipppewas, earning Second Team honors were senior offensive lineman
Brayden Swartout, junior linebackerJordan Kwiatkowskiand senior defensive backDonte Kent, who was a Second Team selection as both a defensive back and return specialist. Senior running backMarion Lukesgarnered Third Team honors.Both Kent and Lukes earned All-MAC honors for the third consecutive year, while Swartout is a second-year honorees.
The All-MAC team and yearly football awards are picked and voted upon by the conference's 12 head football coaches. The entire team is posted below.
Donte Kentearns All-MAC honors for the third consecutive year (First Team in 2022 and Second Team in 2023 and 2024). He expanded his leadership responsibilities as he served as the team's captain in all 12 games. From his cornerback position, Kent finished the 2024 season with 53 tackles (33 solo), eight pass breakups and 0.5 sack. He also emerged as the Chippewas' punt returner and ended up with 16 punt returns for 217 yards (13.56 average) and a 68-yard touchdown in the season's first game against Central Connecticut State. He concluded the year ranked No. 2 nationally in punt return touchdowns (1) and No. 5 in punt returns (13.56 yards per return).In his five-year, 53-game, 48-start career at Central Michigan, Kent made 235 tackles (171 solo), 4.5 tackles for loss, 1.5 sack, two forced fumbles, one fumble recovery and one blocked kick. He set the school's career record with 47 career pass breakups and ranked No. 2 all-time in passes defended (49). With his 13.56 yards per punt return, he ended his career ranked No. 10 on the school's season list. The Harrisburg, Pa. native entered the year as a Jim Thorpe Award Watch list player and consensus All-MAC preseason honoree. Kent is a Sport Management major. He has accepted an invitation to the Hula Bowl.
An Essexville, Mich. native, Swartout takes home All-MAC honors for the second time in his career. In 2024, Swartout started and played in 11 of 12 games at right tackle and was part of CMU's offensive line that allowed just 26 sacks on the year. Over his three-year, 11-start, 34-game career, Kwiatkowski has amassed 138 tackles (69 solo), 14.5 tackles for loss for 31 yards, intercepted one pass and broke up five passes. He has totaled 10 or more tackles in six career games.
A Charlestown, Ind. native, Lukes is a three-time All-MAC honoree (First Team as a kickoff returner in 2023, Third Team in 2021, Third Team in 2024). He also played a leadership role as he served as team captain for all 12 games. As a preseason nominee for the Doak Walker and Paul Hornung Award and consensus preseason All-MAC recipient, Lukes led the Chippewas in all-purpose yardage (1,290), rushing yards (788), rushing touchdowns (five), kickoff returns (22-342), and total touchdowns scored (six). He concluded the year ranked No. 27 in the nation in all-purpose yardage (117.27), ranked No. 8 in the MAC in rushing yards (71.6 yards per game), and No. 2 in all-purpose yards (117.3 yards per game).
In his 44-game career, Lukes has totaled 3,988 combined all-purpose yards and scored 17 total touchdowns. Of his 17 touchdowns scored, he has 13 rushing, two receiving, and two on kickoff returns. In his career, he has five 100-yard rushing games, three 200-yard all-purpose games, 15 100-yard all-purpose games, two 3-touchdown games, and 15 100-yard all-purpose games. He concluded his career ranked No. 11 in all-purpose yards (3,988), No. 3 in kickoff return yards (1,441), ranked tied for No. 1 in kick return touchdowns (2), and No. 10 in average yards per kick return. Lukes is an Entrepreneurship major.
